General introduction¶

Flory-Huggins (FH) interaction parameter (\({\chi}\)) is included in the FH theory to quantify the thermodynamic interaction energy between distinct components. This parameter is an important ingredient in mesoscale simulations of polymers, usign DPD 1 (Dissipative Particle Dynamics) or MesoDyn 2 techniques.

Recently, some authors have proposed the use of ab-initio methods to estimate this parameter between segments 3 or a molecular cluster 4

CHIRIPA is a Python framework that allows one to calculate the interaction parameter (\({\chi}_{ij}\)) by determining the interactions between two monomers (or segments) at a molecular level using QM and DFT methods. The methodology implemented closely follows the algorithms proposed by Blanco-Fan 5 , 6 and Okuwaki et al. 3 , 7

CHIRIPA stands for CHI inteRactIon PArameter. The word chiripa is a Spanish word that means “by luck” making reference to the use of random numbers in the implemented algorithms.
